The new Challenge TB mechanism will support the MOH to address the high burdens of TB, MDR-TB, and TB/HIV and to achieve the objectives of Botswana's National Tuberculosis Strategic Plan, as well as the 2015 Millennium Development Goal for TB. As follow-on to the TB CARE 1 project, Challenge TB will continue the work of strengthening TB services in Botswana to improve prevention, diagnosis, treatment and care, especially for the poorest and most vulnerable populations in high-risk settings. By utilizing locally-owned and generated innovations and research, and cutting-edge technical expertise, as well as coordinating and collaborating closely with the Global Fund activities, the Challenge TB project will maximize impact with limited resources. The aim of this activity is to achieve the following three objectives: to expand access to TB prevention services; to improve patient-centered quality care systems for TB, MDR-TB and TB/HIV; and, to sustain and enhance health systems that deliver TB services. This last objective ensures that TB challenge project builds capacity within health systems for sustainability and smooth transition to GoB. This is a new mechanism without any pipeline funds. Its focus is provision of TA with no reportable indicators. Evaluation of the project is done as part of the overall BNTP evaluation.
